revised_title: The Piscian Stars: A Study of Carbon Absorption and Spectral Characteristics
tldr: The author investigates the Piscian stars, a group of deep red, low-magnitude stars with spectra predominantly featuring carbon absorption. By analyzing the spectral characteristics and comparing them to the solar spectrum, the author concludes that these stars represent an advanced stage in the cooling of meteoritic vapours and suggests a classification system based on the gradual addition of other absorptions to carbon.
